alert.note: Alert for Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 10:20AM EDT until July 29 at 6:54PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Bell, Harlan, Knox, Leslie, Letcher and Perry. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1020 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harlan, Cumberland, Loyall, Evarts, Lynch, Benham, Wallins Creek, Rosspoint, Golden Ash, Kitts, Clovertown, Harlan Gas, Coxton, Baxter, Ages, Sunshine, Tway, Chevrolet, Putney and Elcomb.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
